definition: definitely/absolutely (not)/(scoffing or dismissive interjection) Yeah, right./Tut!/to grind/close to/eager/to correspond to/see also 反切[fan3 qie4]
to break down/to break into pieces/fragmentary

sentences.english: Let Pedrico chop it up to use in fish traps.
sentences.chinese: 他讓彼得利科把它切碎了做魚食。

sentences.english: You'll need a sharp knife and a wooden board for hashing up that meat.
sentences.chinese: 你需要一把利刀和一塊菜板來切碎那塊肉。

sentences.english: For example one of my main stable foods are 500g of minced meat.
sentences.chinese: 例如，我的經常性主食是500克切碎的肉。

sentences.english: Or such mangling can be performed automatically after an executable is created.
sentences.chinese: 或者也可以等到可執行文件生成之後再自動化切碎。

sentences.english: I gave away a block of cheddar cheese with crumbled bacon in it.
sentences.chinese: 我還放棄了一塊切達乾酪，裏面還有切碎的培根肉。

sentences.english: First, I sauteed the onions and garlic, then added the chopped tomato.
sentences.chinese: 我先炒過洋蔥和蒜，然後加了切碎的番茄。

sentences.english: Place the chopped chocolate into a heatproof bowl.
sentences.chinese: 把切碎的巧克力放在耐高溫的碗中。

sentences.english: Add chopped thyme into the marinate and mix well.
sentences.chinese: 之後加入少許切碎的百里香，攪拌均勻。

sentences.english: The machine can shred all kinds of vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 這臺機器可將各種蔬菜切絲切碎。

sentences.english: She chopped the carrots for the stew.
sentences.chinese: 她把胡蘿蔔切碎放在燉的菜裏。

sentences.english: A new type of cotton stalk shredding and used polythene film collecting combined machine was developed and designed.
sentences.chinese: 摘要研製了棉秸稈切碎及殘膜回收聯合作業機。

sentences.english: Let cool and then chop coarsely.
Finely chop the almonds and mix them into the coffee ice cream.
sentences.chinese: 切碎杏仁並把它們拌入咖啡冰淇淋中。

sentences.english: Cut the artichokes and red pepper and fry them.
sentences.chinese: 把朝鮮薊和辣椒切碎然後油炸。

sentences.english: Her nephew is accused of helping her to stab him to death and cut up his body
sentences.chinese: 她的侄子被指控幫助她刺死丈夫，並切碎他的屍體。

definition: to cut up (into pieces)/to slice/to carve/to dice/to shred
to peel/to remove the skin/to tare
to slice/slice/thin section of a specimen (for microscopic examination)
to mash/to beat to a pulp
chunks obtained by repeatedly cutting a vegetable diagonally and rotating the vegetable after each cut
